alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 07 at 12:47PM PDT until June 09 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE DOUBLE CREEK, NEBO, AND STURGILL BURN SCARS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Double Creek, Nebo, and Sturgill burn scars. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including parts of Union and Wallowa counties. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Double Creek, Nebo, and Sturgill burn scars is expected during the period of the watch. Please stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scars, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
